text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['2. mapakazakazakat a yalalaw so sinsi', '裝死嚇老師', 'Faking death to scare the teacher', '', 'si apen Kotan/Jinovoy (M, 75, Yayo)', '王仁德，男，75，椰油村', '']

S.FORM: a noka-pi-vat-vatek namen rana, manga ka-kteh am, “mi ta na mi-vat-vatek” koan ko si apen Sidongen am,
S.TRANSL: 這故事是我們學生時代的故事。有一天我對si apen Sidongen說，“我們要去上學了”
This story is from our student days. One day, I said to si apen Sidongen, “Let’s go to school!”

W.TRANSL: 當.以前-動綴-疊-學生時代

S.FORM: “nohon”, ma-ngay namen a, k-ian namen rana do pi-vate-vatek-an a,
S.TRANSL: “好” 。我們就一起去上學，然後就到了學校
“Okay.” and we went to school. Then we got to school.

S.FORM: tateng am, na-nao-en na yamen am, ikong to ko á-tenng-i,
S.TRANSL: 老師開始上課教我們，老師說“ （講日語） ”，我哪裡懂什麼？
The teacher, who was Japanese, started off the class in Japanese, and I could not understand.

S.FORM: “ángay rana jito, ta ya ka tey-má-teneng” koan na yaken am, simzod-an na rana do atang ko a,
S.TRANSL: 老師對我說“你過來！因為你太聰明了（意反）” ，一去就被打了屁股
“Come here, smarty-pants.” he said, and then spanked me when I got there.

S.FORM: mi-’oya-’oya ko am, to ko rakép-a jia o si-sipzot na am, to namen mi-pi-pázang-i a,
S.TRANSL: 我一氣，就奪走他手上的木棒（教鞭）。我們就扯來扯去的（搶棒子）
I was very angry, so I tried to take away his stick. We fought over it for a while.

S.FORM: ana! tang a, o sinsi am, to maci-pázang-i do si-sipzot na, ta i-ka-teneng mo o ri,
S.TRANSL: 喝！他是老師耶！怎麼可以跟老師搶棒子（教鞭）？你這樣怎麼會學到東西呢？
“Hey, He is a teacher! How dare you try to take a teacher’s stick? How can you learn anything this way?

W.TRANSL: 虛.動綴.與人-拉扯-處焦.虛

S.FORM: “a ya mo i-pa-makbak!”, “y-angay ko imo a lio-en do obo-wbot-an, do ta-taci-an”,
S.TRANSL: “你為什麼打人！” “我要把你丟到便坑裡，小便池裡”
“Why did you hit me?” “I’ll throw you into the sewage tank!”

S.FORM: to na i a-lio-a yaken am, to na i pa-telem-a yaken am, to ko i ma-na-navak do rako a ranom a sombing no tao a,
S.TRANSL: 說著就把我丟到便坑的正中央去了
That’s just what he did. He threw me into the middle of the sewage tank.

S.FORM: to ko na sabóy-a am, “ana! a ya s-om-agpian”, ratateng am, to ko sabóy-a am, to-da a-cíwciw, ta o sinsin am to níwciw-a,
S.TRANSL: 我用手將便池的水潑向老師去。“天啊！他瘋了。” 我再潑他一次，老師就嚇跑了。哪有人這樣對待（追跑）老師的？

After he threw me in, I sprayed him with the contents of the tank. “God, he’s insane!” the teacher cried as he backed up. I sprayed him again, scaring the teacher away. How is it possible that a person would chase a teacher like that?

S.FORM: “ay, zakat-en ka ya an?” koan na yaken a, mi-ratateng am, “na, ciana, ta ya rana adoa ka vate-vatek a, há-hap rana o siken a, k-angay mo rana m-arios”,
S.TRANSL: 老師對我說“唉，真想打死你！” 很久以後，老師說“嗯，好了，已經過了兩個鐘頭了，給你肥皂去洗澡吧”
“I really want to kill you,” the teacher said. After a long time, the teacher finally said, “Okay, it’s been two hours. Here’s the soap. Now, go get a bath.”

S.FORM: to ko mi-aw-áwat do vanoa no Imowrod a, “páka-rala rana!”
S.TRANSL: 我在紅頭村的港口一直游泳。“好了，上來了！”
I kept swimming at the harbor of Imowrod. “Okay, come on up!”

S.FORM: koan ko am, “ta! to ko maka-rala-i”, a y-al-alaw ko sia,
S.TRANSL: 我想“我才不上岸呢！” 我只是想嚇嚇他的
“Why should I come up?” I thought. I wanted to scare him.

S.FORM: to ko nóvoz do wawa am, to ko a-atta-áttaw a mi-ta-tangay a, ka-ine-ynawa ko a,
S.TRANSL: 一下我又跳下海裡去，仰著浮在水上一動也不動，只有呼吸著
Again I jumped into the water and did the dead man’s float.

S.FORM: tateng am, i-ká-law na yaken ni Makaiyawey am, to nóvoz rana am, to na i ngap-a yaken a,
S.TRANSL: 後來si Makaiyawey老師很擔心我，就下水並把我拖回岸上
My teacher si Makaiyawey was worried and jumped down to bring me to shore.

S.FORM: tang, ta ji ko ngin-inawan am, to na ma-mingít-an yaken a, am-ian rana do tey-rala am, ji ko na nginawan a,
S.TRANSL: 其實，老師在拖我上岸時我是有呼吸的，但上了岸之後，我就暫停呼吸
I was breathing, but as soon as he brought me to shore, I stopped breathing.

S.FORM: “a ya na to-da a-wakwak!”, to ko ngile-ylamdám-a si Makaiyawey ito am, to ngáhah a m-alaw a.
S.TRANSL: “慘了，他死了！” ，他嚇得呼吸急促。而我在試探老師si Makaiyawey
“Oh, no, he’s dead!” I had wanted to test my teacher si Makaiyawey’s limits, and he was so scared that his breathing was rapid.

S.FORM: ma-níring sira o aro a ni-rakeh na a mi-vate-vatek a karoan namen am,
S.TRANSL: 我們很多的學長都說
A lot of the older students were saying,

S.FORM: “ángay kamo panci-an o mikalsong!”, to da i manci-an a,
S.TRANSL: “快去叫警察來” ，於是有一些人就去叫警察
“Go call the police!” so some people went.

S.FORM: to ngósok am, to-da a-nanat o velek na ni Makaiyawey, “a ya ni-ma-kongo ya?”
S.TRANSL: 警員下來後，說“他是怎麼了？” si Makaiyawey則嚇得心驚肉跳
After the police came, he asked, “What happened? Si Makaiyawey became very scared.”

S.FORM: “ya ko ni-tahem do obo-wbot-an am, ángay rana parios do wawa, koan ko am, ya to-da angay do Jimataretarek ito am, ya to-da a-átta-attaw rana” koan na,
S.TRANSL: “我是處罰他泡便池裡，後來叫他去海上洗澡，他就去Jimataretarek的海上漂了起來”
“I punished him by making him stay in the sewage tank, then when I told him to get a bath, he went to the seas of Jimataretarek and just floated there.”

S.FORM: “wo, apia ya, ji mang-avay jia si ama na, a kena o ya o anak na ni ama na” koan da, “a ji abo o akma sang”.
S.TRANSL: “喔，這怎麼辦？他父親會罵人呢，這是他僅有的孩子（獨生子）” ，“不會有事的”
“Oh, what can we do?” “His father will be angry because he is their only son!” “Everything will be all right.”

S.FORM: ratateng am, to da miás-a o kazangangan ko am, ta ji ngian pa do dang so koysang a, to da angay-an yaken do koysang a,
S.TRANSL: 他們摸了摸我的胸口，然後把我帶去衛生所觀察，因為那時候已有衛生所了
At that time there was already a clinic. They touched my chest, and then took me to the clinic to be looked over.

S.FORM: “ta ya ji a-pia a, ya ji ngin-inawa a” ji ko mapa-cimi-cimit a,
S.TRANSL: “他還好啦，他還有氣息” 。我眼睛連眨一下都不眨
“He’ll be all right because he’s still breathing.” I didn’t even blink.

S.FORM: ratateng am, to ko ng-kakab rana am, “wo, ya rana apia” koan na ni Makaiyawey am,
S.TRANSL: 後來我就深深的呼了一口氣，“喔，他好了！” si Makaiyawey叫著
After that I took a deep breath. si Makaiyawey shouted, “Oh, he’s okay!”

S.FORM: “ya ka pia an? ya mo ka-teng-an yaken an” koan na yaken ni Makaiyawey
S.TRANSL: si Makaiyawey問我“你還好嗎？你知不知道我是誰？”
“Are you all right? Do you know who I am?” si Makaiyawey asked me.

S.FORM: ji ko pa mi-zi-ziak a, m-ównay a ka-dengdeng-an so kanen am, “síno ka?” koan ko am,
S.TRANSL: 我沉默了好一會兒，大約是煮一鍋飯之久的時間，我才說“你是誰？”
I was silent for a while, about time enough to cook a pot of rice, then answered, “Who are you?”

S.FORM: “ya rana ma-viay” koan da no aro a ka-raray ko a, asa poo namen a mi-vate-vatek.
S.TRANSL: 我的許多同學說“他活了” 。當時我們學生大概有一百名左右吧
“He’s alive,” my classmates said. We had approximately 100 students.

S.FORM: mimín-en da yaken a cita-en a, “ta ji a-tey-mákey-ki-awat ori a, a to lang do jia a to na ngnéj-i,
S.TRANSL: 他們都過來看我，然後說“其實他是個游泳高手，為什麼在這裡游泳會溺水？
“He’s a strong swimmer, so how is it possible that he nearly drowned?” they all said that as they came to see me.

S.FORM: m-ównay am, ka-to ko rana ngin-inawa-n a, to ko rana nanek a,
S.TRANSL: 很久以後我就恢復正常呼吸，然後就自己站起來了
After a long time, I could breathe normally and stand by myself.

S.FORM: “wo, a ikong ya me-yngen jimo?”, “ta ikong ya me-yngen?”
S.TRANSL: “喔！你哪裡痛嗎？” “我哪有什麼痛的？”
“Oh! Does it hurt anywhere?” “What do you mean, ‘does it hurt?’”

S.FORM: ratateng am, “no ya ka akma so sang a ya ni-k-amot-an am, to ka rana angay do ili nio”, “nohon”, to ko rana angay a.
S.TRANSL: 老師說“好吧，今天你溺水了，就讓你先回家去休息吧” ，“好” ，我就回家去了
“Okay, since you nearly drowned, you can go back home for today” the teacher said. “Okay.” Just like that, and I was on my way home.

S.FORM: i-k-ási na yaken ni apen Sidongen ito am, to maci-lolo a,
S.TRANSL: 後來si apen Sidongen可憐我，就陪我一起回家去了
Si apen Sidongen took pity on me and went home with me.

S.FORM: ta do ili namen am, kena iya ori o map-apo-apo so ka-pi-aw-awat namen do ili namen”,
S.TRANSL: 在我們村裡，他可是常常帶頭領我們去游泳呢！”
“In our village he’s always the first one to lead us in swimming.”
